label: HubSpot CRM API
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Hubspot CRM API.

tools.name: AddAllFromSourceListToDestinationList
tools.description:
Add records from a source list to a destination list in HubSpot.

This tool transfers all records from a specified source list to a destination list in HubSpot CRM, ignoring duplicates. Suitable for destination lists with manual or snapshot processing and source lists with fewer than 100,000 memberships.

parameters.name: destination_list_id
parameters.description: The ILS ID of the MANUAL or SNAPSHOT destination list to which the source list records are added.

parameters.name: source_list_id
parameters.description: The ILS ID of the source list from which records are added to the destination list.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: AddToHubspotCrmList
tools.description:
Add records to a specified HubSpot CRM list.

Use this tool to add records to a specific HubSpot CRM list. Only works for lists with a processing type of MANUAL or SNAPSHOT. Records that don't exist or are already members will be ignored.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The ILS ID of the MANUAL or SNAPSHOT list to add records.

parameters.name: record_ids_to_add
parameters.description: An array of strings representing the IDs of the records to add to the list.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ArchiveCallInHubspot
tools.description:
Archive a call in HubSpot CRM by moving it to the recycle bin.

Use this tool to move a specific call, identified by its `callId`, to the recycling bin in HubSpot CRM.

parameters.name: call_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the call to be archived in HubSpot CRM.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ArchiveCallsBatch
tools.description:
Archive a batch of calls by their IDs.

Use this tool to archive multiple calls in HubSpot CRM by providing their IDs. Archived calls can be restored within 90 days, but call recordings are permanently deleted. Refer to HubSpot's documentation for more details on restoring activities.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: ArchiveCrmProperties
tools.description:
Archive a list of properties in HubSpot CRM.

    Use this tool to archive a provided list of properties within a specified object type in HubSpot CRM. It returns a confirmation of successful archiving, regardless of the properties' initial state.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: crm_object_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of CRM object (e.g., 'contacts', 'companies') for which the properties should be archived.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

This tool is used to create multiple quotes at once using HubSpot CRM's batch creation endpoint. Ideal for automating the quote generation process for multiple clients or deals.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"quotes":[{"client":"Client A","amount":1000,"currency":"USD","description":"Quote for Client A"},{"client":"Client B","amount":1500,"currency":"USD","description":"Quote for Client B"}]}

Create a service record in HubSpot CRM.

This tool creates a new service object in HubSpot CRM with the specified properties and returns the created object, including its ID. It's useful for adding new service records to the CRM system.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"name":"New Service Record","description":"Description of the new service record","status":"active","customer_id":"12345"}

tools.name: EditHubspotObject
tools.description:
Partially update a HubSpot CRM object with specified properties.

    This tool performs a partial update on a HubSpot CRM object identified by the `serviceId` or a unique property value using the `idProperty` query parameter. It overwrites provided properties while ensuring read-only or non-existent properties result in errors. Properties can be cleared with an empty string.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: object_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier or `{serviceId}` for the object to be updated. This can be an internal object ID or a unique property value when used with `idProperty`.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: unique_property_name
parameters.description: The name of a unique property for the object, used instead of the internal ID if specified.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: FetchHubspotListMemberships
tools.description:
Retrieve memberships of a HubSpot list by order of record ID.

Use this tool to fetch the memberships of a specific list in HubSpot CRM, sorted by `recordId`. The results can be ordered in ascending or descending order based on the presence of an `after` or `before` offset.

parameters.name: list_identifier
parameters.description: The ILS ID of the HubSpot list to retrieve memberships for.

parameters.name: before_offset_token
parameters.description: The paging offset token for the page before the previously requested records, used to sort records in descending order.

parameters.name: number_of_records_to_return
parameters.description: Defines how many records to retrieve in the response, with a maximum value of 250.

parameters.name: paging_offset_after_token
parameters.description: The paging offset token for the page that comes after the previously requested records. If provided, records will follow this offset, sorted in ascending order. Takes precedence over the before offset.

tools.name: FetchHubspotObjectById

parameters.name: object_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the HubSpot CRM object to retrieve. This can be the internal object ID or another unique property value if specified by the `id_property` parameter.

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: The type of the HubSpot CRM object you want to retrieve. Examples include 'contact', 'company', and 'deal'.

parameters.name: associated_object_types
parameters.description: Specify object types to retrieve associated IDs for, separated by commas. Non-existing associations will be ignored.

parameters.name: properties_with_history
parameters.description: A list of properties to return along with their historical values. Ignored if properties are not present.

parameters.name: return_only_archived_results
parameters.description: Set to true to return only archived results. Set to false to include all results.

parameters.name: return_properties
parameters.description: List of properties to return for the object. Ignored if not present on the object.

parameters.name: unique_property_name
parameters.description: Specify the property name that uniquely identifies the object.

tools.description:
Retrieve HubSpot CRM records by ID or custom property.

    This tool retrieves records from HubSpot CRM using either a record ID or a custom unique value property. It should be called when you need to access specific CRM records based on these identifiers.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: return_archived_records_only
parameters.description: Set to true to return only HubSpot CRM records that have been archived.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: FetchListByName
tools.description:
Fetch details of a list by its name and object type.

Use this tool to obtain the information of a specific list in HubSpot CRM by providing the list name and object type ID.

parameters.name: list_name
parameters.description: The name of the list to fetch. This is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: object_type_id
parameters.description: The object type ID for the list. Example: `0-1` for `CONTACT`.

parameters.name: include_filters
parameters.description: Set to true to include filter branch definitions in the response. By default, filters are not included.

Fetch list memberships ordered by addition date.

Fetch the memberships of a HubSpot CRM list, ordered by the date they were added. Useful for retrieving member records in an ascending order based on addition time, or in descending order if a 'before' offset is used.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The unique ILS ID of the list to retrieve memberships from.

parameters.name: after_paging_offset_token
parameters.description: The token for the page that comes after the previously requested records, sorted in ascending order. Takes precedence over 'before'.

parameters.name: before_offset_token
parameters.description: The paging offset token to retrieve records preceding the specified page, sorted in descending order.

parameters.name: record_limit
parameters.description: Specify the number of records to return, with a maximum limit of 250.

tools.name: GetMultiplePostalMailObjects
tools.description:
Retrieve multiple postal mail objects by IDs or unique values.

    This tool retrieves multiple postal mail objects from HubSpot CRM using their internal IDs or unique property values. It is useful when you need to access detailed information on several postal mail entries at once.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: include_archived
parameters.description: Set to true to include archived postal mail objects in the results.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: HubspotBatchArchiveAssociations
tools.description:
Batch archive associations in HubSpot CRM.

    This tool is used to archive multiple associations between specified object types in HubSpot CRM in a single batch operation. Call this tool when you need to efficiently remove associations between records, such as contacts and companies, or deals and tickets, in bulk.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: source_object_type
parameters.description: The type of the source object for the associations to be archived (e.g., 'contacts', 'companies').  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: target_object_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of the object to which the association is directed, e.g., 'company', 'deal'.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

Retrieve conversion details for a specific list in HubSpot CRM.

Use this tool to check for upcoming conversions or to get details of past conversions for a list.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The ID of the list for which you want to retrieve conversion details.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RetrieveCrmObject
tools.description:
Fetch CRM object details by ID or unique property.

Use this tool to retrieve details of a CRM object by specifying the object type and ID. You can control the properties returned using query parameters.

parameters.name: object_id
parameters.description: The ID of the CRM object to retrieve. This can be the internal object ID or a unique property value specified by the id_property.

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of CRM object to retrieve, such as "contacts", "companies", or "deals".

parameters.name: associated_object_types
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. Missing associations are ignored.

parameters.name: properties_list
parameters.description: An array of property names to be returned in the response. If any specified properties are not present, they will be ignored.

parameters.name: properties_with_history
parameters.description: List properties to be returned with their historical values. If a property doesn't exist, it'll be ignored.

parameters.name: return_only_archived_results
parameters.description: Set to true to return only archived results.

parameters.name: unique_property_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of a property with unique values for this object to identify it instead of the default ID.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RetrieveCrmRecords
tools.description:
Retrieve CRM records by ID or custom unique property.

    This tool retrieves CRM records using either their record ID or a custom unique value property specified by the `idProperty` parameter. It is useful for accessing detailed information about specific records stored in the CRM system.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: retrieve_only_archived_records
parameters.description: Set to true to retrieve only archived CRM records.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

parameters.description: Set to true to return only results that have been archived.

parameters.name: associated_object_types
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. Non-existent associations will be ignored.

parameters.name: properties_with_history
parameters.description: List of properties to retrieve along with their value history. Ignored if properties are missing.

parameters.name: return_properties
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of properties to return in response. Ignored if not present on the object.

parameters.name: unique_property_name

parameters.name: filter_by_list_ids
parameters.description: An array of list IDs to filter search results. If not provided or empty, no filter is applied.

parameters.name: filter_by_processing_types
parameters.description: List of processing types to filter results. Valid values: 'MANUAL', 'SNAPSHOT', 'DYNAMIC'. If omitted, no filtering by processing type is applied.

parameters.name: include_additional_list_properties
parameters.description: Specify additional list properties to include in the response. Defaults fetch standard properties like `hs_list_size` and others.

parameters.name: number_of_lists_to_return
parameters.description: The number of lists to include in the response. Defaults to 20 if not provided, with a maximum of 500.

parameters.name: search_query
parameters.description: The term to search for lists by name. Returns all lists if empty.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specify the order in which the lists should be sorted. Acceptable values could be 'asc' for ascending or 'desc' for descending order.

parameters.name: start_offset
parameters.description: The starting point for pagination of list results. Defaults to `0` if not provided.

parameters.description: The word representing a single object. This cannot be changed later.

parameters.description: Specify the word representing multiple instances of the object type. This value is permanent and cannot be changed after setting.

parameters.description: The primary property's name for this object, displayed prominently on the HubSpot record page.

parameters.name: required_properties
parameters.description: List of property names that must be provided when creating an object of this type in HubSpot.

parameters.name: restorable
parameters.description: Indicates if the object can be restored after deletion. Accepts a boolean value.

parameters.name: searchable_properties
parameters.description: List of property names to be indexed for HubSpot's product search, enhancing searchability of the CRM object type.

parameters.name: secondary_display_properties
parameters.description: Names of secondary properties displayed on the HubSpot record page for this object type.

object_description.value: A custom object for tracking project details.

documentationChunks.content: The HubspotCrmApi MCP Server uses the Auth Provider with id `arcade-hubspot` to connect to users' HubspotCrmApi accounts. In order to use the MCP Server, you will need to configure the `arcade-hubspot` auth provider.

summary:
# HubSpot CRM API Toolkit

The HubSpot CRM API Toolkit enables seamless interactions with the HubSpot CRM system, providing tools that harness the extensive capabilities of the CRM ecosystem.

## Capabilities
- Manage and automate CRM objects such as contacts, companies, deals, and more.
- Perform batch operations for creating, updating, and retrieving records efficiently.
- Facilitate associations between various CRM objects and manage their relationships.
- Access detailed control over property management and object schemas.
- Implement GDPR compliance for data management and retrieval.

## OAuth
**Provider**: Unknown  
**Scopes**: automation, crm.dealsplits.read_write, crm.contacts.read/write, etc.

## Secrets
None.
